The post Global tech crackdown appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Big Tech has enjoyed years of unfettered growth, but now the U.S., EU, China and India have launched unprecedented crackdowns on some of the biggest names in the business. Lawmakers and regulators are going after anti-competitive practices and looking at privacy and security at companies such as Facebook and Apple, Google and Amazon. Reuters is keeping clients and readers ahead on this huge story, delivering comprehensive coverage and, in some cases, even spurring action by lawmakers and corporations.

item.title: Reuters reveals Facebook to win conditional EU nod for Kustomer buy
item.dc:creator: Alexis Badke
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that Facebook is set to gain EU antitrust approval for its acquisition of Kustomer – an acquisition […]

The post Reuters reveals Facebook to win conditional EU nod for Kustomer buy appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that Facebook is set to gain EU antitrust approval for its acquisition of Kustomer – an acquisition that media have reported would be worth more than $1 billion. The approval comes after Facebook offered remedies that allow rival products to function with those of the U.S. customer service startup.

A buying spree of startups by big companies has triggered concerns on both sides of the Atlantic, with regulators worried about so-called killer acquisitions aimed at shutting down potential rivals before they are big enough to be a threat.

item.dc:creator: Alexis Badke
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the Russia’s central bank would like to ban investments in cryptocurrencies in Russia because it sees […]

The post Reuters reveals Russian central bank to seek ban on investment in cryptocurrencies; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the Russia’s central bank would like to ban investments in cryptocurrencies in Russia because it sees risks to financial stability in the rising number of crypto transactions. Leading cryptocurrency bitcoin fell after the Reuters report. Commenting on the Reuters report, Elvira Nabiullina, governor of the central bank, said the regulator could not welcome investments in cryptocurrencies or support Russia’s financial infrastructure being used for such investments.

The post Reuters reveals Russian central bank to seek ban on investment in cryptocurrencies; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

The post Reuters provides insight into how Wall St bank analysts grapple with capital impact of new derivatives rule appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters took readers on a deep dive into how Wall Street analysts are scratching their heads over the extent to which an arcane new derivatives rule will affect the performance of big banks as they wrap up the fourth quarter. The rule is one of a slew of measures introduced by regulators to discourage banks from taking excessive risks in the over-the-counter derivatives market which contributed towards the 2007-2009 financial crisis.

item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:

The post Reuters reveals Royal Dutch Shell confirms delay in sale of Texas refinery to Mexico’s Pemex appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters broke the news that a sale of Royal Dutch Shell’s controlling interest in a Texas refinery to Mexican state oil company Pemex has been delayed until next year. Sources said a review of the deal by U.S. Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States had been expected to wrap up this month, but there have been additional delays. Shell in May disclosed an agreement to sell its 50% interest in the refinery to partner Pemex for about $596 million.

item.title: Reuters ahead with news on disruption of major banks’ return-to-office plans
item.dc:creator: Alexis Badke
item.description:

The post Reuters ahead with news on disruption of major banks’ return-to-office plans appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters has been ahead with news on major banks curbing return-to-office plans as Omicron has spread, including two hours ahead of the competition with news that Jefferies was asking staff to work from home again after a spate of COVID cases. Reuters was also ahead with news that Fidelity was delaying return-to-office for some locations and JPMorgan was requiring unvaccinated workers to work from home, news that was widely followed by other media.

The post Reuters exclusively reports U.S. lawmakers call for sanctions against Israel’s NSO, other spyware firms appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that a group of U.S. lawmakers is asking the Treasury Department and State Department to sanction Israeli spyware firm NSO Group and three other foreign surveillance companies they say helped authoritarian governments commit human rights abuses. Their letter, seen by Reuters, also called for sanctions on top executives at NSO, the United Arab Emirates cybersecurity company DarkMatter, and European online bulk surveillance companies Nexa Technologies and Trovicor.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reports Malaysia telcos call for second 5G provider
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that Malaysia’s major wireless carriers have recommended the government allow a second 5G service to be set […]

The post Reuters exclusively reports Malaysia telcos call for second 5G provider appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that Malaysia’s major wireless carriers have recommended the government allow a second 5G service to be set up, ahead of a cabinet decision on whether to go ahead with a plan for a single wholesale network. The cabinet will decide by January whether to allow multiple 5G providers, following concern from industry players that a single state-run network could hamper competition, Communications and Multimedia Minister Annuar Musa said last week.

item.title: Reuters first to report Amazon says India revoking Future deal would boost Reliance, hurt competition
item.dc:creator: Erica Ascher
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that Amazon has warned India’s antitrust body that revoking its 2019 deal with Future Group […]

The post Reuters first to report Amazon says India revoking Future deal would boost Reliance, hurt competition appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that Amazon has warned India’s antitrust body that revoking its 2019 deal with Future Group would send a negative signal to foreign investors and allow local retail behemoth Reliance to “further restrict competition.” The Competition Commission of India is reviewing its prior approval of the $200 million investment the U.S. company made in a Future unit in 2019, amid allegations that Amazon concealed facts when it sought approval for the transaction. While Future is staring at liquidation, the legitimacy of the small $200 million deal could have far-reaching consequences for India’s retail sector.

The post Reuters first to report Amazon says India revoking Future deal would boost Reliance, hurt competition appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters ahead with details of Canada’s monetary policy framework renewal
item.dc:creator: Alexis Badke
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that the Bank of Canada will continue to target 2% inflation when the central bank […]

The post Reuters ahead with details of Canada’s monetary policy framework renewal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that the Bank of Canada will continue to target 2% inflation when the central bank and the Canadian government jointly release their new monetary policy framework, which is renewed every five years. Citing a source familiar with the matter, Reuters reported that the renewal will include new language on the importance of employment to the economy. The Bank of Canada and the Canadian government released their new policy two days later, confirming the details revealed by Reuters.

The post Reuters ahead with details of Canada’s monetary policy framework renewal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
